content.text: the temperature of a toy train
the distance travelled by a toy train in one second
Which quantity can be measured using a ruler?
the average speed of the car
the acceleration of the car
A car is driven from one town to another town along a road that is not straight.
The driver of the car divides the total distance travelled by the total time taken.
Which quantity does the driver calculate?
distance
acceleration
Which quantity can be determined from the area under a speed-time graph?
1 The weight is the quantity of matter in the object.
2 The weight is the effect of a gravitational field on the object.
3 The weight is the force of attraction between the object and the Earth.
Which statements describe the weight of the object?
1, 2 and 3 B 1 and 2 only C 1 and 3 only D 2 and 3 only
Students are asked for a statement about the weight of an object.
Three of the statements are listed.
Samples of three different liquids have equal masses.
The volumes of the samples are \(190cm^{3}\), \(200cm^{3}\) and \(235cm^{3}\).
The liquids are poured into a large measuring cylinder and the liquids form three separate layers because they do not mix.
What are the readings on the measuring cylinder at the two boundaries between the samples?
The car is speeding up.
The car is slowing down.
A car moves along a level road.
The diagram shows all of the horizontal forces acting on the car.
Which statement is correct?
A car is travelling around a circular track at a constant speed, as shown.
In which direction is the resultant force on the car?
A railway truck of mass 8000 kg moves with a velocity of \(1.0 \text{m/s}\) to the right.
It collides with a railway truck of mass \(12 000 \text{kg}\) moving at \(2.0 \text{m/s}\) to the left.
The two trucks become joined to each other when they collide and move off together.
What is the velocity of the two trucks after the collision?

table.html:
distance between the particlesmotion of the particles
Aclose togethervibrating
Bclose togetherrandom
Cfar apartvibrating
Dfar apartrandom

content.text: A \(1.6 \text{m/s}\) to the left
B \(0.80 \text{m/s}\) to the left
C \(0.80 \text{m/s}\) to the right
D \(1.6 \text{m/s}\) to the right
A stone is dropped from a bridge which is 22 m above a river.
What is the speed of the stone when it hits the water?
Only the temperature of the gas increases.
Both the pressure and the temperature of the gas increase.
B \(21 \text{m/s}\)
10 Which row describes the particle structure of a gas?
The particles of a gas in a container of fixed volume gain energy in the kinetic store.
Which effect does this have on the gas?
They experience a change in force, which results in a pressure equal to \(\frac{\text { momentum }}{\text { area }}\).
They experience a change in force, which results in a pressure equal to momentum Ã— area.
Gas particles exert a pressure when they collide with the walls of a container.
Which statement about the gas particles is correct?
condensation
boiling
A solid changes into a liquid.
Which term describes this change in state?
resistor, stop-watch and ruler
stop-watch, voltmeter and balance
The diagram shows some of the apparatus used to determine the specific heat capacity of a metal block.
Which additional pieces of apparatus are required to find the specific heat capacity?
Four different surfaces are at the same high temperature.
The rate at which the object receives energy is the same as the rate at which it transfers energy away.
Which statement is correct?
There is no energy transfer to or from the object.
Which surface emits thermal radiation at the slowest rate?
An object has a constant temperature.
Which row correctly describes light waves?

table.html:
wave typedirection of vibration
Alongitudinalparallel to direction of wave travel
Blongitudinalperpendicular to direction of wave travel
Ctransverseparallel to direction of wave travel
Dtransverseperpendicular to direction of wave travel

content.text: A narrow beam of light consists of two waves of different wavelengths.
The beam of light hits a sharp edge.
Which effect will be seen beyond the sharp edge?
A Both waves continue along the same straight line as before.
B Both waves bend sharply and continue along a new straight line.
C
The wave of longer wavelength bends round the sharp edge more than the wave of shorter wavelength.
D
The wave of shorter wavelength bends round the sharp edge more than the wave of longer wavelength.
The image is the same size as the object and 60 cm from the object.
The image is the same size as the object and 30 cm from the object.
An object is placed 30 cm in front of a plane mirror.
Which statement describes the image of the object?
The angle of incidence inside the glass must be less than the critical angle.
The angle of incidence inside the glass must be equal to the critical angle.
Which statement about total internal reflection at a glassâ€“air boundary is correct?
a point in a transverse wave where the particles of the medium are close together
A a point in a longitudinal wave where the particles of the medium are close together
a point in a longitudinal wave where the particles of the medium are far apart
What is a compression?
Which row describes the magnetic field around a weak magnet?

table.html:
direction of fieldspacing of field lines
Anorth pole to south poleclose together
Bnorth pole to south polefar apart
Csouth pole to north poleclose together
Dsouth pole to north polefar apart

content.text: A second piece of resistance wire of the same material with a diameter of 0.50 mm also has a resistance of \(6.0 \Omega\).
What is the length of the second piece of wire?
A 0.60 m length of resistance wire with a diameter of 0.25 mm has a resistance of \(6.0 \Omega\).
B
C
D
A circuit contains a cell with an electromotive force (e.m.f.) of 2.0 V. The current in the circuit is 2.0 A.
How much energy is transferred by the cell in 2.0 minutes?
the energy supplied per unit charge as charge passes through the cellï¼Ž
the charge that passes through the cell per unit timeï¼Ž
What is the electromotive force (e.m.f.) of a cell?
Four lamps and four switches are connected to a power supply, as shown.
When all the switches are closed, all the lamps are lit.
When one of the switches is then opened, only one lamp goes out.
Which switch is opened?
In which mains electric wires are the fuse and the switch placed?
30 The diagram shows a wire moving downwards in a magnetic field between two magnetic poles.
There is an induced current in the wire because of the movement.
The induced current produces a force on the wire.
In which direction is this force?
When the generator shown rotates, there is an a.c. electromotive force (e.m.f.) across the resistor between points P and Q.
Diagram 1 shows the position of the coil at time \(t=0\).
The coil rotates clockwise. At time \(t_{1}\), the coil position is horizontal, as shown in diagram 2.
The graph shows the output e.m.f. between points P and Q plotted against time.
Which point shows the e.m.f. at time \(t_{1}\) ?
to ensure that the magnetic field in the motor stays in the same direction at all times
to ensure that the magnetic field in the motor changes direction every half rotation
What is the purpose of the split-ring commutator in an electric motor?
Alpha particles are more penetrating because they have less kinetic energy than beta particles.
Which statement correctly compares properties of these two particles?
Alpha particles are less penetrating because they have less kinetic energy than beta particles.
A beta particle has less mass than an alpha particle, but the speed of a beta particle emitted during radioactive decay is approximately 20 times greater than the speed of an alpha particle.
emission of \(\gamma\)-rays during the decay of a radioactive nuclide
attraction of opposite charges
Which observation provides evidence for the nuclear atom?
cell death
cancer
Which effect on living things is not caused by ionising radiation?
X emits \(\alpha\)-particles.
Which statement about X must be correct?
A nucleus of X is unstable.
Isotope X is radioactive.
500 counts/minute
The source is placed close to a detector that is connected to a counter, as shown.
The average background count rate is 20 counts/minute.
At the start of the experiment, the count rate recorded by the counter is 1000 counts/minute.
What is the count rate 10 minutes later?
490 counts/minute
An experiment is done to measure the radiation from a radioactive source. The source has a half-life of 10 minutes.
north to south
east to west
In which direction does the Sun appear to move every day, when viewed from the Earth?
What is the approximate distance between the Milky Way and this distant galaxy?
A distant galaxy is moving away from the Milky Way at \(4 400 000 m / s\).
The orbit of Mercury is closer to the Sun than the orbit of the Earth is to the Sun.
How do the values of the gravitational field strength of the Sun near Mercury and the orbital speed of Mercury compare to those values for the Earth?
